newsitem.title: USA: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. weekly rice cash market summary -- USDA.

text.p: In the South, rice prices were steady to 1.00 per cwt higher. Long grain milled rice prices were selling mostly at 20.00 per cwt.; Medium grain traded mostly at 18.00-19.00; Second heads were steady and Brewers remain in very tight supply with few quotes at 14.50-15.50. Rice by-products were steady to 5.00 higher.

In California, rice prices were steady with Medium grain selling mostly at 19.50. Rice bran was steady to 2.00 higher. California rice ship loadings for the week ended Jan 11, at the Port of Sacramento, three ships each loaded 10,000 mt of U.S. No.1 bagged Medium Grain rice destined for Japan.

Inspections of California rice for export: There were 661,680 cwt of U.S. Medium Grain rice inspected for the week ending Jan 11. The yearly total since Oct 1, 1996 is 4,081,401 cwt compared to 2,443,152 cwt a year ago.

Domestic shipment: Offers, FOB mills, milled rice, dollars per cwt, bagged. (All milled rice grade 2 not to exceed 4 percent brokens, except California grade 1. All second heads grade 4 or better, Second heads and Brewers bulk.)
Feed by-products prices (dollars per short ton, FOB mills).
